ingredients.item: 125g slightly salted butter, softened, plus extra for greasing
2 medium Waitrose British Blacktail Free Range Eggs

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 180°C, gas mark 4. Grease a 20cm square cake tin and line with baking parchment. Put the butter, sugar, eggs and flour into a bowl. Mix the cocoa with 2–3 tbsp cold water to make a paste and add to the bowl. Beat everything together until smooth and creamy. Fold in the cherries.
Spoon into the tin and level the surface. Bake for 35 minutes or until risen and just firm to the touch. Leave in the tin for several hours to cool and firm up.

Blend the cherry preserve with 2 tbsp boiling water to loosen. Press through a sieve into a bowl (don’t forget to scrape the pulp off the underside of the sieve so you have enough). Blitz the coconut chunks in a food processor until finely chopped then tip out onto a plate.

Remove the cake from the tin and, using a sharp knife or bread knife, trim off the crusty edges then cut into 16 squares. Lightly brush the cakes all over with the preserve and turn them in the coconut until lightly coated.
